An R6 Class to represent sampled network data

Source: R/sampledNetwork-Class.R
sampledNetwork.Rd

An R6 Class to represent sampled network data

An R6 Class to represent sampled network data

Details

The function sample and prepare_data produces an instance of an object with class sampledNetwork.

All fields of this class are only accessible for reading. This class comes with a basic plot, summary and print methods

Active bindings

samplingRate

The percentage of observed dyads

nNodes

The number of nodes

nDyads

The number of dyads

is_directed

logical indicating if the network is directed or not

adjacencyMatrix

The adjacency matrix of the network

covarArray

the array of covariates

covarMatrix

the matrix of covariates

dyads

a list of potential dyads in the network

missingDyads

array indices of missing dyads

observedDyads

array indices of observed dyads

samplingMatrix

matrix of observed and non-observed edges

observedNodes

a vector of observed and non-observed nodes

NAs

boolean for NA entries in the adjacencyMatrix

Methods

Public methods

  • sampledNetwork$new()

  • sampledNetwork$plot()

  • sampledNetwork$show()

  • sampledNetwork$clone()

Method new()

constructor

Usage

sampledNetwork$new(adjacencyMatrix, covarMatrix = NULL, covarArray = NULL)

Arguments

adjacencyMatrix

The adjacency matrix of the network

covarMatrix

the matrix of covariates (default is NULL).

covarArray

the array of covariates (default is NULL).

Method plot()

plot method for sampledNetwork

Usage

sampledNetwork$plot(
  clustering = NULL,
  main = paste("Network with sampling rate:", signif(self$samplingRate, 3))
)

Arguments

clustering

an optional vector of clustering memberships, default to NULL.

main

a character for the title of the plot

Method show()

show method

Usage

sampledNetwork$show()

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

sampledNetwork$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

Examples

## SBM parameters
directed <- FALSE
N <- 300 # number of nodes
Q <- 3   # number of clusters
alpha <- rep(1,Q)/Q     # mixture parameter
pi <- diag(.45,Q) + .05 # connectivity matrix

## simulate a SBM without covariates
sbm <- missSBM::simulate(N, alpha, pi, directed)

## Sample network data
sampled_network <-
     missSBM::sample(
       adjacencyMatrix = sbm$adjacencyMatrix,
       sampling        = "double-standard",
       parameters      = c(0.4, 0.8)
     )

summary(sampled_network)

#> Sampled Network with 300 nodes and sampling rate equal to 0.482 
#>  - 21604 observed dyads (7183 links and 14421 no-links)
#>  - 23246 missing dyads
print(sampled_network)

#> <sampledNetwork>
#>   Public:
#>     adjacencyMatrix: active binding
#>     clone: function (deep = FALSE) 
#>     covarArray: active binding
#>     covarMatrix: active binding
#>     dyads: active binding
#>     initialize: function (adjacencyMatrix, covarMatrix = NULL, covarArray = NULL) 
#>     is_directed: active binding
#>     missingDyads: active binding
#>     NAs: active binding
#>     nDyads: active binding
#>     nNodes: active binding
#>     observedDyads: active binding
#>     observedNodes: active binding
#>     plot: function (clustering = NULL, main = paste("Network with sampling rate:", 
#>     samplingMatrix: active binding
#>     samplingRate: active binding
#>     show: function () 
#>   Private:
#>     D: 301 601 602 901 902 903 1201 1202 1203 1204 1501 1502 15 ...
#>     D_miss: 903 1203 1204 1504 1801 1802 1803 1805 1806 2103 2104 21 ...
#>     D_obs: 301 601 602 901 902 1201 1202 1501 1502 1503 1505 1804 2 ...
#>     directed: FALSE
#>     nas: FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE TRUE FALSE FALSE TRU ...
#>     phi: NULL
#>     R: FALSE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE FALSE TRUE TRUE FALSE FAL ...
#>     S: FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FA ...
#>     X: NULL
#>     Y: 0 0 1 1 0 1 NA 0 0 NA NA NA 0 1 NA NA 1 NA NA NA 1 0 1 0 ...
plot(sampled_network, clustering = sbm$memberships)
